content.question: The description in the third paragraph (“She’d . . . wind”) suggests that the cornfield in part symbolizes

choices.label: Lila’s realization that there is still much work to be done and her determination to finish that work
Lila’s apprehension about the future and her fear that her secure life with her new husband will not last
the age difference between Lila and her husband and her husband’s inevitable decline
the cyclical nature of time and the promise that good fortune will always reappear after any period of hardship

content.answer: Lila’s apprehension about the future and her fear that her secure life with her new husband will not last

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Identify and explain the function of a symbol.
